g2:c.METHOD.g2:a.TEXT:
jmail-connect (io: class jmail-interface, smtp-host: text, port: integer)
begin
change the text of the gsi-connection-configuration of io to "tcp-ip host @"[smtp-host]@" port-number [port]";
end

g2:c.KB-WORKSPACE.g2:a.TITLE-BAR-TEXT: JMAIL Object Definition And Private APIs

c.PROTOOLS-DOCUMENTATION-DETAILS.ua.PROTOOLS-DESCRIPTION: Interface object for the JMail Bridge. Contains a number of attributes who's values are used by the 'high-level' api's to call rpc's in the bridge.

g2:Structure.g2:sa.DESCRIPTION: The user-name to log into the email server. Is used for both getting and sending email. For Microsoft Exchange, the following works: - use pop3 as protocol. - user-name = '<domain-name>/<nt-user-name>/<first part of email-address>'. So for instance: 'Gensym/vt/vterpstra'. Changing the protocol to 'imap' also worked, but now many emails appear to not of type 'plain/text' and thus are ignored by the bridge. Apparently using pop3 forces the server to generate plain/text.
The password to log into the email server. Is used for both getting and sending email.

g2:c.REMOTE-PROCEDURE-DECLARATION.g2:a.TEXT: declare remote _jmail-rpc-send-mail-bundle(structure, text, text, integer, truth-value, text, text, sequence) = (text)
declare remote _jmail-rpc-send-mail(structure, text, text, integer, truth-value, text, text, sequence, sequence, sequence, text, text, text) = (text)
declare remote _jmail-rpc-get-mail(structure, text, text, integer, truth-value, text, text, text, truth-value, integer, integer) = (sequence)
declare remote _jmail-rpc-send-mime-mail(structure, text, text, integer, truth-value, text, text, sequence, sequence, sequence, text, text, sequence) = (text)

g2:c.FUNCTION-DEFINITION.g2:a.TEXT: _jmail-gsi-config(io) = (structure ( jmail-delivery-confirmation: the jmail-delivery-confirmation of io, download-attachment-directory-path: the download-attachment-directory-path of io, jmail-debug: the jmail-debug of io) )

c.PROTOOLS-CHAPTER.ua.PROTOOLS-CHAPTER-SHORT-DESCRIPTION: This chapter describes the classes defined in JavaMail Gateway Adaptor.

g2:c.PROCEDURE.g2:a.TEXT:
jmail-bridge-default-delivery-report-handler (io: class jmail-interface, info: value)
begin
post "JMAIL Delivery Report: [info]";
end

jmail-bridge-default-error-handler (io: class jmail-interface, error-msg: text)
begin
post "JMAIL ERROR: [error-msg]";
end
